results.title: The Puppetmaster = Hsimeng Rensheng
results.creator_credit: Xiaoxian Hou, Huakun Zhang and Quiu Fusheng
results.brief_description: ‘The Puppetmaster’ dramatises the life of 84-year-old Li Tien-Lu, Taiwan’s most famous puppeteer, who was also an actor in three of Hou’s films. The story spans the years from Li’s birth in 1909 through World War II and the end of 50 years of Japanese occupation in 1945 and uses a combination of staged scenes, performances and Li’s feisty direct addresses to the camera. Hou explains his motivation for working with Li in these terms: “I had always wanted to film Li Tien-Luk as a subject because I feel that he is like a living encyclopaedia of Chinese tradition. In filming him, it is as if I am flicking through the pages of this encyclopaedia. He is different from our generation, has none of the modern penchant for rationalization, none of our setbacks or negative qualities, or our pain. People from that age would tackle problems with flexibility but from a strong principled position. Life and death and social relationships to them are straightforward propositions. Simply put, I see in Li Tien-Luk the ardent self-confidence of the Chinese and their generosity of heart. In modern Taiwan, these qualities have all but vanished.” ‘The Puppetmaster’ is the first instalment of Hou’s ‘Taiwan Triology’ covering the history of Taiwan from the Japanese occupation to Japan’s surrender. Cast includes Li Tien-lu, Lin Chung, Cheng Kuei-Chung and Hung Liu. In Mandarin and Taiwanese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Puffed-up dragon
results.brief_description: Combines delightfully animated paper cutouts and music to tell a story about a huge, hungry dragon who comes to a medieval kingdom and frightens the people because they do not know that he is a vegetarian.

results.title: The Printing industry
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the four methods of printing -letterpress, lithograph, gravure and silkscreen and pre-production stages such as typesetting, and composing of type, proofing and the plate making. Also how to go about getting a job in the industry.

results.title: The Printed circuit story
results.brief_description: Shows the complete manufacture of printed circuits as well as recommended tools and approved repair techniques for replacing components, soldering, and servicing of printed wiring.

results.title: The Preparation of food: Stone age to space age
results.brief_description: Discusses the increasing importance of food ad its preparation, particularly when men are confined for long periods of time in space stations similar to NASA’s Lunar Receiving Laboratories.

results.title: The Polish National Radio Orchestra. No. 1
results.brief_description: The Polish National Radio Orchestra performs Tchaikovsky’s Fifth Symphony in E minor as originally presented at the Melbourne Town Hall during a tour of Australia. Conductor: Jerzy Katlewicz. Reel One: First Movement Reel Two: Second & Third Movement.

results.title: The Plan
results.creator_credit: C Larry Roberts, Dianne Orr and Bescher Films
results.brief_description: Features Michele Meservy, Utah’s Young Mother of the Year for 1978. Follows this intelligent and committed Mormon Mother through the rigours of her day, taking care of her five young children and husband, and reflecting on her life, obligations and spiritual destiny.

results.title: The Pirogue maker
results.creator_credit: Arnold Eagle and Humble Oil and Refining Company
results.brief_description: The shaping of a small boat known as a pirogue, from a cypress tree trunk; an intriguing record of a fast-dying art by descendents of the Acadians who left Nova Scotia in 1755. Flaherty’s films “Louisiana story” led to the tracing of one of the few remaining pirogue makers, Hebron Allemand whose work was recorded with Acadian folk songs giving local background.

results.title: The Pipette
results.creator_credit: L.M. Simmons, Craig Baynes and Australian Teaching Films
results.brief_description: One of a series of instructional films demonstrating the use of chemical apparatus; correct method of using the pipette; cleaning and preparation; filling; adjustment of liquid level to measuring mark; discharging the pipette; washing and cleaning after use.

results.title: The Picture gallery
results.brief_description: Intrinsic in many great paintings is a sense of movement. Rather than seeming static, the figures appear to be caught in motion. A young Czech animator, Jan Trmal, has taken ten such paintings and by separating their elements has actually set them in motion for a brief time to the music of Gianfranco Maselli, Antonin Vranicky and Johann S. Bach.
